reasons_to_visit.details: Often held in early/mid-May (check annual dates!), this is Funchal's iconic festival. Experience stunning flower carpets, parades (Wall of Hope, Allegoric Float Parade), flower market, workshops, and concerts.
Madeira is arguably at its most beautiful. Gardens like the Botanical Garden, Monte Palace, and Palheiro Gardens are in full, spectacular bloom. Landscapes are lush and vibrant.
May offers excellent hiking conditions with warm, generally sunny weather and longer daylight hours. Perfect for exploring levadas and mountain trails.
Enjoy comfortable warmth (avg. high 21-23°C) ideal for sightseeing, walking, and enjoying outdoor cafes without the intensity of high summer.
The Atlantic warms to around 20-21°C, making swimming, snorkeling, and water activities increasingly appealing.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: If your visit coincides with the Festa da Flor, expect *very* large crowds, fully booked accommodation, and peak prices. Book flights, hotels, and car rentals *months* in advance.
Even outside the festival period, May sees prices rise as it transitions into the high season. Book ahead for better deals.
Tourist numbers increase significantly compared to early spring, meaning popular spots (cable car, gardens, key viewpoints) will be busier.
While generally sunny, spring showers or cloudy spells are still possible, particularly in the mountains.

weather.precipitation: Low chance of rain, mostly sunny and pleasant. Mountain areas can be cooler/cloudier.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, light sweaters/cardigan, potentially a light waterproof. Comfortable walking shoes essential. Sunscreen and sunglasses needed.

tourism_level.crowds: High to Very High, especially if Flower Festival falls in this period. Extremely busy during festival events.
tourism_level.pricing: High, potentially peak prices if Flower Festival is active. Book everything far ahead.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant, festive, beautiful spring atmosphere. Can be very crowded during festival days.

events_holidays.name: Labor Day (Dia do Trabalhador)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Generally a quiet day, locals may have the day off.
events_holidays.notes: Banks, schools, some businesses closed. Tourist services generally operate. Public transport on holiday schedule.

events_holidays.name: Madeira Flower Festival Main Events (if applicable)
events_holidays.description: Key events like the Wall of Hope Ceremony (children building a flower wall), the main Allegoric Float Parade, Flower Market (Avenida Arriaga), flower carpets, workshops.
events_holidays.notes: Consult the official Festa da Flor program. Parades draw huge crowds; find viewing spots early.

unique_experiences.where: Funchal Center (Avenida Arriaga, Praça do Município, Parade Route)
unique_experiences.description: Immerse yourself in the festival: admire intricate flower carpets, watch the colourful parades, visit the Flower Market, enjoy the concerts and festive atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check the official program for timings/locations. Be prepared for massive crowds during parades. Wear comfortable shoes.
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Free to observe; costs for food/purchases

unique_experiences.description: Explore the hillside garden during peak blooming season, enjoying vast plant collections, themed areas, and stunning views over Funchal.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Can be busy, especially if Flower Festival is on. Accessible by bus or dedicated cable car. Allow 2-3 hours.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk a Levada Surrounded by Spring Growth
unique_experiences.where: Various levadas (e.g., Levada dos Balcões, Levada do Furado)
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy hiking along the irrigation channels amidst lush vegetation and potentially wildflowers.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Choose trail based on fitness. Check weather forecast. Wear appropriate footwear. Bring water.

unique_experiences.activity: Ride the Funchal Cable Car to Monte
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy panoramic views over a vibrant Funchal on the ascent to Monte village.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Can have queues, especially during festival time. Combine with Monte Palace Garden visit.

weather.precipitation: Very low chance of rain. Consistently sunny and warm.
weather.general_tips: Pack primarily summer clothing, but keep a light layer for evenings/mountains. Sunscreen essential.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate to High. Still busy, but potentially slightly calmer if Flower Festival was earlier in the month.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring/early summer weather. Ideal conditions for exploring the whole island.

events_holidays.name: Madeira Classic Car Revival (Often late May)
events_holidays.description: Classic car show and rally held in Funchal (Praça do Povo usually), attracting enthusiasts and showcasing vintage automobiles.
events_holidays.notes: Check annual dates and program if interested.

unique_experiences.description: Explore this stunning multi-level garden with its oriental pagodas, vast plant collection, lakes, tile panels, and museum spaces.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow ample time (3+ hours). Wear comfortable shoes for walking slopes/steps. Accessible via cable car or bus.

unique_experiences.where: Starting from Achada do Teixeira (easier) or Pico do Arieiro (harder)
unique_experiences.description: Reach the highest point in Madeira for breathtaking 360-degree views above the clouds (weather permitting).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather forecast carefully (can change quickly!). Go early. Bring layers, water, food, sun protection. Route from Achada do Teixeira is shorter/easier.

unique_experiences.description: Take a boat trip to spot marine life. May offers good chances to see dolphins and various whale species.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book in advance. Choose tours focused on responsible observation. Bring sunscreen.

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy Sunset & Dinner in Zona Velha
unique_experiences.description: Relax at an outdoor table in the atmospheric Old Town, enjoying dinner and drinks as the evening cools down.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Many restaurants to choose from. Can get busy; booking might be wise for popular spots.
